meanings.definition: The action of extending the period of validity of something.
meanings.sent1: The renewal of my library card allowed me to continue borrowing books.
meanings.sent2: The renewal of the contract ensured our partnership would last another year.
meanings.sent3: His constant renewal of promises made him known as the 'renewal king'.
meanings.sent4: The renewal of hope after a long winter felt like a warm embrace.
meanings.sent5: The renewal of the subscription brought a smile to her face.

meanings.definition: The process of restoring or replenishing something.
meanings.sent1: The renewal of the garden involved planting new flowers and shrubs.
meanings.sent2: The renewal of energy after a good night's sleep was refreshing.
meanings.sent3: The renewal of the old house turned it into a cozy retreat.
meanings.sent4: The renewal of the forest after a fire was a testament to nature's resilience.
meanings.sent5: The renewal of strength after exercise made him feel invigorated.

meanings.definition: The act of making something new or fresh again.
meanings.sent1: The renewal of the painting brought out its vibrant colors once more.
meanings.sent2: The renewal of the recipe with fresh ingredients made it taste even better.
meanings.sent3: The renewal of the room's decor gave it a modern and stylish look.
meanings.sent4: The renewal of the relationship added a spark of excitement to their interactions.
meanings.sent5: The renewal of the tradition each year kept it alive and cherished.
